_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 10th, 1:36 PM
Good afternoon riders and skiers! Fresh corduroy and cooler temps set the stage for a firm and fast day on the slopes. Tomorrow's forecast calls for cloudy skies with similar temperatures in the high 20s to low 30s at both the base and summit. Strong winds could affect lift operations tomorrow. Groomers will be out tonight tackling the firm and frozen trails from last night's freeze. Look forward to top-tier groomers, along with firm, variable conditions on natural terrain. All terrain off Bravo, Heaven's Gate, and Valley House is for advanced skiers and riders due to variable conditions. Snowmaking continues to be on pause until temps become cooperative.

Well be getting down on over 450 skiable acres served by 15 lifts and 106 open trails, 30 of which received fresh corduroy overnight. Castlerock and North Lynx lifts will be turning tomorrow from 9:00 AM - 3:45 PM. All ungroomed and natural terrain is suggested for experts only as base coverage has become thin and conditions are variable. Inverness trail is reserved today for racing events. Check out Gate House terrain for some mellow and easy-going groomers, perfect for the kiddos, beginners, or anyone avoiding the icy conditions.

Operations have switched to weekend hours: GMX, Super Bravo, and Heavens Gate kick things off, loading at 8:00 AM. Followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM. This weekend, Ikon Pass holders can score some early turns during Ikon Early Ups. Super Bravo will be loading at 7:30 AM for Ikon pass holders before opening to the public at 8:00 AM. Sugarbush offers a wide range of freestyle parks, whether youre just starting out or training for competitions, weve got you covered. At Mt. Ellen, Riemergasse offers 80 of the finest features on the East Coast, while Lincoln Peak is home to two mini parks featuring 12 creative elements. Sugar Run made its season debut earlier this week with 27 features including 3 jumps, bringing our total feature count to 119!

Sharpen Your Swing This Winter! Join PGA Pro Roger King Jan 12th from 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM at the SIM Suites in the SHaRC for exclusive winter golf lessons. Using state-of-the-art simulators, you'll get personalized tips and real-time feedback to improve your swing, accuracy, and overall game. Check out all of our winter events!

All uphill routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, check out our uphill travel policy for more info.
